children.subject: something to keep in mind if you haven't already seen this: https://www.vice.com/en/article/pkdyqm/surveillance-startup-used-own-cameras-to-harass-coworkers

I looked into Verkada a lot a while ago because they had a virtual tech talk. It seems like a cool product, and they hired one of Yann LeCunn's former mentees so evidently their tech is legit. But the Glassdoor ratings are pretty disturbing--many complaints about frat boy culture / lack of professionalism / harassment (I'm a guy by the way FWIW). I would also recommend searching on Blind for Verkada posts. You might be able to find more stuff there.

In addition, during their tech talk they demo'd some of their cameras in their office, and I thought it was a recording since there were plenty of people walking around mask-less. But then they said "here is a livestream of our office blah blah blah oh haha looks like mask compliance isn't so great today." I was pretty surprised that a Bay Area tech company hasn't gone WFH yet, and I would be wary of company culture that does stuff like mandate in-person working with loose mask enforcement.

No idea what Lucid does or what the company is like, so no input there. Congrats on getting both offers though!

Another thing to keep in mind is if you are a junior or not. If you are, I would go with the company which has a higher rate of return offers, while also keeping into account TC. If you are a sophomore, I would go with the company which offers a greater opportunity to learn

history.content:
Not sure whether it’s acceptable to ask these type of questions here

i got internship offers from those two companies and need to make a decision before Nov 10th. Lucid Software only gave me a week to decide, really short. Anyone know about these two companies and can give some advice? Many thanks y’all
history.subject: Lucid Software or Verkada?
